  • Method Details

    • contentUploadFinished

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, value="/content/upload-finish/{ContentID}") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> contentUploadFinished(@PathVariable("ContentID") UUID contentID)
      GET /content/upload-finish/{ContentID} : Handle content processing after upload finishes. After the upload has been finished in the object storage, the storage server will ping this endpoint with the content id. This endpoint will change the status of the content from uploading to processing and then further process the content stored in the object store. Note that this endpoint also changes the status of the content.
      Parameters:
      contentID - (required)
      Returns:
      Content status successfully changed. (status code 200) or In case the previous status of the content is not uploading, this endpoint will not change the status to processing and will not do any task on the content. (status code 400) or The specified content ID does not exist. (status code 404)

    • createContent

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/content", produces="application/json") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponsePreSignedURL> createContent()
      POST /content : Publish content for the currently authenticated user. On successful completion of this request, the response contents a pre signed url in which the user needs to upload the content. On successful completion of document update, it's responsibility of the document uploading server to notify the application server that the content has been uploaded.
      Returns:
      Contents the generated pre signed URL, on which the client has to upload the content. (status code 200) or Invalid parameters for getting presigned URL. (status code 400)

    • deleteContentById

      @RequestMapping(method=DELETE, value="/content/{ContentID}") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteContentById(@PathVariable("ContentID") UUID contentID)
      DELETE /content/{ContentID} : Delete a specific piece of content.
      Parameters:
      contentID - (required)
      Returns:
      Content deleted successfully. (status code 200) or Bad request. Invalid or missing parameters. (status code 400) or Unauthorized. Invalid authentication provided. (status code 401) or Forbidden. Access to delete the content is denied. (status code 403) or Content not found. (status code 404)

    • getAllContent

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, value="/content", produces="application/json") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseGetUserContent> getAllContent(@Valid @RequestParam(value="platform",required=false) @Valid Optional<TypeSupportedPlatform> platform, @Valid @RequestParam(value="title",required=false) @Valid Optional<String> title, @Valid @RequestParam(value="publishedOn",required=false) @DateTimeFormat(iso=DATE) @Valid Optional<LocalDate> publishedOn, @Valid @RequestParam(value="hashtags",required=false) @Valid Optional<List<String>> hashtags)
      GET /content : List all contents for the currently authenticated user.
      Parameters:
      platform - (optional)
      title - (optional)
      publishedOn - (optional)
      hashtags - (optional)
      Returns:
      List of content retrieved successfully. (status code 200) or Bad request. Invalid filter parameters. (status code 400) or No content found for the given filters. (status code 404)

    • getContentCollaborationById

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, value="/content/collaboration/{ContentID}") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> getContentCollaborationById(@PathVariable("ContentID") UUID contentID, @Valid @RequestParam(value="status",required=false) @Valid Optional<TypeCollaborationStatus> status)

      contentID - (required)
      status - The current status of the collaboration request. (optional)
      Returns:

    • sendCollaborationInvitations

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/content/collaboration/{ContentID}", consumes="application/json") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> sendCollaborationInvitations(@PathVariable("ContentID") UUID contentID, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid RequestCollaboration requestCollaboration)
      POST /content/collaboration/{ContentID} : Invite users to collaborate on content.
      Parameters:
      contentID - (required)
      requestCollaboration - (required)
      Returns:
      Invitation sent successfully. (status code 200) or Bad request. The input is invalid or missing required fields. (status code 400) or Content not found. The specified content ID does not exist. (status code 404) or Conflict. Invitation already exists for the user. (status code 409)

    • updatePendingInvitesForContentById

      @RequestMapping(method=PATCH, value="/content/collaboration/{ContentID}", consumes="application/json") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> updatePendingInvitesForContentById(@PathVariable("ContentID") UUID contentID, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid RequestCollaborationAction requestCollaborationAction)
      PATCH /content/collaboration/{ContentID} : Accept or decline invitations. The user can accept or decline content request invitation. Need to consider whether to make a new endpoint for accept/decline invitations and use this endpoint for modifying access control instead. Reference of Google Zanziber can be used for access control.
      Parameters:
      contentID - (required)
      requestCollaborationAction - (required)
      Returns:
      Invitation status updated. (status code 200) or Bad request. The action is invalid or the request is malformed. (status code 400) or Invitation not found. No invitation for the specified content ID. (status code 404) or Conflict. The action cannot be performed due to a conflict in the invitation status. (status code 409)
